creator: theking2

content:
The first issue can be fixed by assigning the correct smtp server to the accounts: in Account Settings, select the weav13 account in the left pane, then in the right pane Outgoing Server (SMTP) drop-down, select the weav13 smtp server. Repeat with the weaver12 account: select the weaver12 smtp server.

The (secure) incoming port for POP is 995, 993 for IMAP. If you aren't getting mail on the phone, it might be because it's first downloaded on the desktop and then deleted from the server. Most users with multiple devices would set the accounts as IMAP on all devices. To switch from POP to IMAP, the account has to be added again as IMAP:

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Convert_a_POP_account_to_a_IMAP_account

TWC seems to work with secure and non-secure settings, but secure is recommended:

https://www.postbox-inc.com/setup/email-settings/access-twc-via-imap-smtp
creator: sfhowes

content: The issue is why is Thunderbird creating the "Archives" folder ? How can i stop it from doing so ?
creator: bhaslinux

content:
Hello there We have read the message We try to help


hello, I have read your message. Do you want to get rid of the messages that you receive daily or even hourly? These messages are from your Amazon topics. You can try using an anti-malware program. Installing a firewall can also help or you purchase an antivirus program that includes it. I see that you are using a very outdated version of Thunderbird. This could also be the case with a somewhat outdated operating system on your computer. Please try to update it to our latest version of Thunderbird regarding the Thunderbird Software that you have installed. I will to see if you can update in one go from this version you have now.

https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/115.0.1/releasenotes/

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/organize-your-messages-using-filters

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/upgrading-older-version-thunderbird

Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Hi, If you are trying to "Move" an event to a calendar owned by the same user you will not succeed.

There is a issue with that that we are tracking here: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1873834 More info is available also here: https://github.com/thunderbird/knowledgebase-issues/issues/34#issuecomment-1892184060

Have a great day!
creator: shopov.bogomil
